item.title: grok
item.description: ˈɡrɒk, grohk, transitive verb To understand profoundly through intuition or empathy To have or to have acquired an intuitive understanding of; to know (something) without having to think To get the meaning of something “Grok” is a neologism coined in the book Stranger in a Strange Land by Robert A. Heinlein. I’ve never read the book, the term is ingrained enough into the world of software that I’m confident most people who use the term have never even heard of the book or know the word’s origins.
